text: <@U11MANG9G> Thank you. This is quite interesting document, while it is bit difficult to understand the "binding" concept for me.

In summary, Bob creates a sign key and a certificate, Bob passes the certificate to Alice beforehand, Alice installs the certificate using metadata of a deploy transaction, Bob signs the "binding" and send it in a transaction, the chaincode function verifies the signature. If it is verified, the chaincode allows to invoke an operation in the function. Am I understanding it correctly?
Update: Code has been completed for enrolling and registering users while supporting appropriate authorization headers. <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-862>

QQ: in v1 we'll have plug-able certificate authority but if Customer needs some custom encryption mechanism will it be possible or not really? This is the question from the bank and it occurs that central authority might not be ok, with SHA3, for example but provides something different... 
Or this question should be asked in <#C0Z4NBUN6|fabric-consensus-dev> ?
<@U1FBDMBMG>: Yes, your understanding is spot on! :slightly_smiling_face:
